And, then, of course, they want to keep Obamacare and open borders. Oh, and, yes, they want you didn't want their crumbs back. utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That's 30 seconds CNN never ever had. They said nothing. And tying Trump to a litany of conspiracies that he has nothing to do with is even harder, which brings us to our next topic, which is the deep state. Finally, welcome to Wall Street Journal, they're now casting doubt, welcome aboard, guys, on Mueller's ongoing witch-hunt., claiming, quote, it's a tainted antecedent political bias. It looks like the I.G. report is opening everyone's eyes to what we have been showing you for nearly a year. And now, nine Republican lawmakers and now asking the Justice Department to provide the names of every person, past and present, who has worked for Mueller's probe. This comes as Rod Rosenstein and the FBI Director Wray are set up this Thursday before the House Judiciary Committee in what will be an extremely explosive and revealing hearing. And this Wednesday, disgraced FBI agent Peter Strzok, he's going to testify on Capitol Hill behind closed doors. Open the doors, show some sunlight. And, finally, we have a bombshell new report from The Hill detailing how the former FBI Director Comey personally killed the deal between the U.S. government and WikiLeaks Julian Assange. And, of course, Assange is actually the one living person that we know for sure that would be able to give proof regarding the source of, quote, the emails. Listen to what Assange told me when I interviewed him in January last year.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Did Russia give you this information or anybody associated with Russia?

utterances.speaker: JULIAN ASSANGE, FOUNDER, WIKILEAKS
utterances.sentences: Our source is not a state party. So the answer for our interactions is no.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You did not get this information about the DNC, John Podesta's emails, can you tell the American people a thousand percent you did not get it from Russia or anybody associated with Russia?

utterances.speaker: ASSANGE
utterances.sentences: We can say -- we have said repeatedly over the last two months that our source is not the Russian government, and it is not a state party.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You mean, we could have gotten the truth from Julian Assange? What did Comey hiding or is there something we don't yet, you know, know about? After all, we've been through, make the deal. Wasn't Russia? Prove it, get it from Assange, let the American people know the truth. Now, we're going to keep digging and digging until we peel back every layer of this deep state. All right. We have a busy breaking news night. When we come back, we're going to talk to two people who experienced firsthand the left's hatred. Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi and House Majority Whip Steve Scalise. Busy news night. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. Here with reaction to our opening monologue, House Majority Whip Steve Scalise. You may remember, he was shot going back a year ago and thank God he's with us today and he's making a full recovery. And also, Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi. Let me go to your incident. You went to see the Mr. Rogers movie, first mistake.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: It's documentary about anti- bullying, about tolerance.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: About respecting each other's differences.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Here's the thing, I want you to tell people how bad this was because the video didn't capture it.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: They're calling you every name in the book.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You had your boyfriend with you.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And what did they say to him that you can say?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Well, we get there. We're waiting in line to get tickets and it's, you know, a documentary about Mr. Rogers and, all of a sudden, this woman comes out of nowhere and starts telling me that I'm ripping babies out of women's arms. Now, who does that sound like? The Peter Fonda quote about Melania.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: So, they can't even come up with their own lines, and I said I'm glad you're videoing me. Let me explain to you, I never agreed with separating the mothers from the babies, and I'm glad the president signed the executive order.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: By the way, neither did the president.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right. I'm glad the president signed the executive order. And I said, you know, this is a congressional issue. They didn't even know who their congressmen were. So, then when they realized if that wasn't working, just F you in my face, screaming at the top of their lungs.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: They were using the P word, the B word, the F word.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The A word -- you know, every word imaginable.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: And come on, aren't you going to protect her? Come on, come on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So your boyfriend.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Trying to get him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: What they are calling him blue eyes?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Blue eyes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You're going to say this to your girlfriend?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: If he would have -- if he would have responded and defended, he gets arrested.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: And that's how I stopped him from defending me. I said they want to hurt you, this is what they want. And there were two more altercations, Sean, after that, after I thought they were gone.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And you -- and they literally at one point, big guys, too, surrounded you.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Big guys blocked me from walking in.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Why are you -- if somebody gets in your grill like that, is that not considered itself an attack.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: It's an assault. It's an assault if they block me from leaving. You know what? They know what they wanted. They wanted to be dragged out in handcuffs. They wanted the same. I wasn't going to give the five minutes of fame.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Why are they doing this to you? Sarah Sanders, Secretary Nielsen- -

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: -- and children? We're going after Baron.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We're going to go after the 4-year-old granddaughter of the president, Melania, Ivanka. Really if they're real tough guys--

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: -- I'm available. Come after me. Follow me. I'll handle it.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Well, and that's it. They didn't know what they were talking about. So then they had two hours while I was in the movie.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And they gathered more people reinforcement.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Of course. They call them reinforcement and they Googled all these things to say. I mean, that's the video that we're showing after the fact. But you know, the police said we're going to take you out the back door. And I said no way. I'm walking out the door that I came in. They're not going bully me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Congressman, first of all, great play at second base.

utterances.speaker: REP. STEVE SCALISE, R-LA.
utterances.sentences: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You were in the studio before the game. That was an unbelievable play.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: But you were in -- the first play of the game. And I watched your piece with my buddy Steve Doocy. But here's the thing. You got shot a year ago. And I know you don't have feeling basically in one foot. Is that correct?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: Yes, the left foot still has a lot of nerve damage. You know, I'm working on that. I do physical therapy three day as week. They sure help me get a lot better but I've got a long way to go.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Here's my question. Do you connect their -- what you saw with Secretary Nielsen and what happened to Sarah, what happened to Pam and the things that are being said about blowing up a White House and the things that are said about Baron Trump and about the president's granddaughter, do you think these words are igniting something that is going to result in somebody getting severely injured or maybe even killed?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: Sean, clearly they're inciteful. I've seen how that kind of inciteful language can lead to something dangerous. And so, there are fine lines to cross. We're a nation that was built on this great idea that you can disagree with people, you can express your disagreement. But resorting to violence is never an excuse.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Did Maxine Waters and Corey Booker cross a line by encouraging people to confront people that like Donald Trump in gas stations and restaurants, confront them, confront them? What are they trying to do here except create a situation that's going to blow?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: I think it crosses the line, Sean. And again, I mean, this is about civility. You should go in one of -- win your ideas in a debate of public opinion. If you can't -- if your ideas are worse, which frankly I think conservative ideas win the day all the time, so then they go and try to resort to name calling and ultimately violence. And that's where I think it crosses the line. And so--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: You're lucky to be alive today. And you know what, and God bless those two -- to think that two Capitol Hill police officers walked in a wide open field with pistols against a rifle, that was basically a death sentence. But they did it anyway. That's how great they are.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: Yes, and they did it anyway. Heroes everywhere.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Heroes.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: And look, the miracles of God, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: God performs real miracles. But we shouldn't get to this. And the left shouldn't -- we didn't tolerate it under Obama. You and I and so many others didn't agree with his policies.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.sentences: But we never condoned this kind of action.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Do you agree with me this isn't a their losing, they lost, that the president is successful, that his economic record and foreign policy record and the fact that Mueller's witch hunt, their great hope is crumbling.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Is that what's causing this? And the election pending?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: I do. I think people are so angry that the president is succeeding that our country is thriving that they're lashing out in any way they can, Sean, at the expend of -- I can take care of myself but at the expense of these people is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: We -- I thought they cared about women and children and had a monopoly of compassion. It's all a crock and it's all a big lie. And this is about politics. And the reason I ran the history lesson is because they do it every two and four years. It's their only playbook.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And somebody is going to get killed. Mark my words, I pray to God I'm wrong.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: But this is getting scary.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.sentences: I agree.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: What you went through you should not have gone through, I'm sorry. Mr. Scalise, same thing. Congressman, same to you. When we come back, huge breaking news. John Solomon, disgraced FBI director James Comey killed a deal that would have given us the proof from Julian Assange. Who gave him the information? We can get the information? Comey doesn't want you to have the information. Here is Sara Carter and Gregg Jarrett, next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: All right. One of our top stories tonight, the Hill's John Solomon breaking this report how James Comey interviewed to kill WikiLeaks immunity deal. Now we reached out to Comey for comment. No. He won't come on this show or comment back to us. Here with more, Fox News contributor and investigative reporter, Sara Carter, the Hill's John Solomon, Fox News legal analyst and author, you see that book it's coming out next month. Order it right now. Amazon.com. Barnes and Nobles.com. This is huge. "The Russia Hoax: The Illicit Scheme that Cleared Hillary Clinton and Framed Donald Trump." Our own Gregg Jarrett. All right. Let me get this straight. John Solomon, there's a deal on the table. The one guy that we know on earth that knows exactly where the e- mail, so-called hack came from. Well, it wasn't so -- where the hack came from.

utterances.speaker: JOHN SOLOMON, VICE PRESIDENT, THE HILL
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: The one guy that knows we could have found out and he would have either offered proof positive if there was no deal and we would have been able to either confirmed Russia or deny Russia. We know Hillary's e-mail server was hacked by at least six foreign intelligent service, so God knows where it came from. But he could have provided evidence and maybe saved the country from all of this crap and Comey stopped it. Why?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, it's a great question. No one in the Justice Department really know why Comey was doing it. Some people didn't even know Comey had done it at the time. But here they are in the middle of negotiations. You got senior justice officials having very constructive conversations with Julian Assange his lawyer and all of a sudden Jim Comey is having a side bar with Senator Mark Warner and he passes his message along to Senator Warner saying cut off the investigation, tell that lawyer to stand down. We don't want Assange here. We don't know the reasons why. And the consequences go even beyond Russia. At that moment Assange had a lot of sensitive documents about the CIA, there was a lot of great negotiating going on and they all fell apart--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: This isn't about whether Assange, this is not about WikiLeaks and Assange, but here is a point that I think we've got to be honest about. I'll throw to Sarah.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Great.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So people like Julian Assange and Kim Dotcom, these are guys that broke in -- he, Assange hacked the DOD and NASA when he was 16. He's now 45. We have 250,000 full time I.T. people working for the government or thereabouts. My question is, you know, fool me once, twice, three, four, 10 times. Shame on you. Fool me 35 years later, shame on me. Why have we not protected everything?

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.sentences: Because it's almost impossible to do so, Sean. The government relies on its ability to protect its documents solely on the employees that have access to these documents. And if they don't -- obviously there's problems within the system. They know the system has faults. And sometimes people within the system, we saw it with Edward Snowden, we've seen it with others like Chelsea Manning. They are able to access these very highly classified documents and somehow get them out of those very classified documents. I think with Julian Assange you brought--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Would the country been better off having found out for sure who did it?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. You agree, Gregg?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: And if Julian was -- absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GREGG JARRETT, LEGAL ANALYST, FOX NEWS
utterances.sentences: Absolutely. I do. And the inevitable conclusion that one can reach here is that Comey knew it wasn't Russia.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: So you think Assange lied--

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: It would have exposed the Russia hoax and it would ruin the narrative of Democrats.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: By the way, I believe that, too. That's the problem.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Right. It was that sweetheart deal of the government.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Make the deal.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: And Comey steps in and he puts a stop to this deal that would have protected in intelligence sources and method in addition--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: That wa part of it, by the way. They would have protected other people.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Yes. Why in the world would Comey stop it unless it hurt him and his dilating probe of Trump?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me go to another topic. We'll put it on the screen for all of you. The president tweeting it out. So there's a hearing Wednesday with Strzok. And he writes, "The hearing with Strzok and other frauds at the FBI and DOJ should be shown to the public on live TV, not a closed door hearing that nobody will see. We should expose these people for what they are. There should be total transparency." I agree with the president. So Strzok is going to get to hide behind closed doors. John Solomon, instead of facing the American people and letting us decide.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think that's one of the frustrations that the American people have. A lot of this investigation is been behind closed doors and it's only been because of some courageous people coming out and talking that we know half of what we know today. At some point there has to be a final accounting of what went on here. And I think it starts with what the FBI did right and wrong. There's another development going on tonight. We still don't have those documents.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me ask one follow up on Assange while it's in my head.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Sure.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Are you convinced, John Solomon, because you're breaking the story--

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: -- that Assange has -- he would have -- he was a guy that will have proof positive. Are you of the belief that he told the truth that it wasn't Russia?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.sentences: I'd love to see the evidence he was going to provide. He was going to provide technical evidence that would answer who did not provide these documents. That would be critical to any investigation and why it was turned away is a great mystery to me. I mean, we should want transparency in the story.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Sara, back to Peter Strzok. Should it be transparent?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.sentences: It should absolutely be transparent. And this is the reason why Peter Strzok's attorney didn't want him to be subpoenaed why he acted like he wanted to volunteer and he allow to speak to Congress. He knew it would be behind closed doors. And he know that because it's not under subpoena because it's going to talk to members of Congress, he may not have to answer any or all of the questions.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: Let me go last question. I'm bouncing back and forth, but this is in my head. So you're saying that American sources and methods as part of the deal with Assange would be protected?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Would have been protected and redacted.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: And maybe would save lives?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.sentences: It could have the potential. So why do we do the deal now?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.sentences: And we have malware that we utilize on other systems that would have been protected as part of the deal. It's incomprehensible with this deal--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY

utterances.utterance: Did Russia give you this information or anybody associated with Russia?

utterances.speaker: JULIAN ASSANGE, FOUNDER, WIKILEAKS
utterances.utterance: Our source is not a state party. So the answer for our interactions is no.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You did not get this information about the DNC, John Podesta's emails, can you tell the American people a thousand percent you did not get it from Russia or anybody associated with Russia?

utterances.speaker: ASSANGE
utterances.utterance: We can say -- we have said repeatedly over the last two months that our source is not the Russian government, and it is not a state party.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You mean, we could have gotten the truth from Julian Assange? What did Comey hiding or is there something we don't yet, you know, know about? After all, we've been through, make the deal. Wasn't Russia? Prove it, get it from Assange, let the American people know the truth. Now, we're going to keep digging and digging until we peel back every layer of this deep state. All right. We have a busy breaking news night. When we come back, we're going to talk to two people who experienced firsthand the left's hatred. Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi and House Majority Whip Steve Scalise. Busy news night. Stay with us.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Here with reaction to our opening monologue, House Majority Whip Steve Scalise. You may remember, he was shot going back a year ago and thank God he's with us today and he's making a full recovery. And also, Florida Attorney General Pam Bondi. Let me go to your incident. You went to see the Mr. Rogers movie, first mistake.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: It's documentary about anti- bullying, about tolerance.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: About respecting each other's differences.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's the thing, I want you to tell people how bad this was because the video didn't capture it.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: They're calling you every name in the book.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You had your boyfriend with you.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And what did they say to him that you can say?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Well, we get there. We're waiting in line to get tickets and it's, you know, a documentary about Mr. Rogers and, all of a sudden, this woman comes out of nowhere and starts telling me that I'm ripping babies out of women's arms. Now, who does that sound like? The Peter Fonda quote about Melania.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: So, they can't even come up with their own lines, and I said I'm glad you're videoing me. Let me explain to you, I never agreed with separating the mothers from the babies, and I'm glad the president signed the executive order.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way, neither did the president.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right. I'm glad the president signed the executive order. And I said, you know, this is a congressional issue. They didn't even know who their congressmen were. So, then when they realized if that wasn't working, just F you in my face, screaming at the top of their lungs.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: They were using the P word, the B word, the F word.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The A word -- you know, every word imaginable.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: And come on, aren't you going to protect her? Come on, come on.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So your boyfriend.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Trying to get him.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What they are calling him blue eyes?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Blue eyes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're going to say this to your girlfriend?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: If he would have -- if he would have responded and defended, he gets arrested.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: And that's how I stopped him from defending me. I said they want to hurt you, this is what they want. And there were two more altercations, Sean, after that, after I thought they were gone.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And you -- and they literally at one point, big guys, too, surrounded you.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Big guys blocked me from walking in.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why are you -- if somebody gets in your grill like that, is that not considered itself an attack.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: It's an assault. It's an assault if they block me from leaving. You know what? They know what they wanted. They wanted to be dragged out in handcuffs. They wanted the same. I wasn't going to give the five minutes of fame.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Why are they doing this to you? Sarah Sanders, Secretary Nielsen- -

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- and children? We're going after Baron.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We're going to go after the 4-year-old granddaughter of the president, Melania, Ivanka. Really if they're real tough guys--

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- I'm available. Come after me. Follow me. I'll handle it.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Well, and that's it. They didn't know what they were talking about. So then they had two hours while I was in the movie.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And they gathered more people reinforcement.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Of course. They call them reinforcement and they Googled all these things to say. I mean, that's the video that we're showing after the fact. But you know, the police said we're going to take you out the back door. And I said no way. I'm walking out the door that I came in. They're not going bully me.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Congressman, first of all, great play at second base.

utterances.speaker: REP. STEVE SCALISE, R-LA.
utterances.utterance: Thanks.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You were in the studio before the game. That was an unbelievable play.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But you were in -- the first play of the game. And I watched your piece with my buddy Steve Doocy. But here's the thing. You got shot a year ago. And I know you don't have feeling basically in one foot. Is that correct?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: Yes, the left foot still has a lot of nerve damage. You know, I'm working on that. I do physical therapy three day as week. They sure help me get a lot better but I've got a long way to go.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's my question. Do you connect their -- what you saw with Secretary Nielsen and what happened to Sarah, what happened to Pam and the things that are being said about blowing up a White House and the things that are said about Baron Trump and about the president's granddaughter, do you think these words are igniting something that is going to result in somebody getting severely injured or maybe even killed?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: Sean, clearly they're inciteful. I've seen how that kind of inciteful language can lead to something dangerous. And so, there are fine lines to cross. We're a nation that was built on this great idea that you can disagree with people, you can express your disagreement. But resorting to violence is never an excuse.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Did Maxine Waters and Corey Booker cross a line by encouraging people to confront people that like Donald Trump in gas stations and restaurants, confront them, confront them? What are they trying to do here except create a situation that's going to blow?

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: I think it crosses the line, Sean. And again, I mean, this is about civility. You should go in one of -- win your ideas in a debate of public opinion. If you can't -- if your ideas are worse, which frankly I think conservative ideas win the day all the time, so then they go and try to resort to name calling and ultimately violence. And that's where I think it crosses the line. And so--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: You're lucky to be alive today. And you know what, and God bless those two -- to think that two Capitol Hill police officers walked in a wide open field with pistols against a rifle, that was basically a death sentence. But they did it anyway. That's how great they are.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: Yes, and they did it anyway. Heroes everywhere.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Heroes.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: And look, the miracles of God, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: God performs real miracles. But we shouldn't get to this. And the left shouldn't -- we didn't tolerate it under Obama. You and I and so many others didn't agree with his policies.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: SCALISE
utterances.utterance: But we never condoned this kind of action.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Do you agree with me this isn't a their losing, they lost, that the president is successful, that his economic record and foreign policy record and the fact that Mueller's witch hunt, their great hope is crumbling.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Is that what's causing this? And the election pending?

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: I do. I think people are so angry that the president is succeeding that our country is thriving that they're lashing out in any way they can, Sean, at the expend of -- I can take care of myself but at the expense of these people is ridiculous.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: We -- I thought they cared about women and children and had a monopoly of compassion. It's all a crock and it's all a big lie. And this is about politics. And the reason I ran the history lesson is because they do it every two and four years. It's their only playbook.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And somebody is going to get killed. Mark my words, I pray to God I'm wrong.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But this is getting scary.

utterances.speaker: BONDI
utterances.utterance: I agree.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What you went through you should not have gone through, I'm sorry. Mr. Scalise, same thing. Congressman, same to you. When we come back, huge breaking news. John Solomon, disgraced FBI director James Comey killed a deal that would have given us the proof from Julian Assange. Who gave him the information? We can get the information? Comey doesn't want you to have the information. Here is Sara Carter and Gregg Jarrett, next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. One of our top stories tonight, the Hill's John Solomon breaking this report how James Comey interviewed to kill WikiLeaks immunity deal. Now we reached out to Comey for comment. No. He won't come on this show or comment back to us. Here with more, Fox News contributor and investigative reporter, Sara Carter, the Hill's John Solomon, Fox News legal analyst and author, you see that book it's coming out next month. Order it right now. Amazon.com. Barnes and Nobles.com. This is huge. "The Russia Hoax: The Illicit Scheme that Cleared Hillary Clinton and Framed Donald Trump." Our own Gregg Jarrett. All right. Let me get this straight. John Solomon, there's a deal on the table. The one guy that we know on earth that knows exactly where the e- mail, so-called hack came from. Well, it wasn't so -- where the hack came from.

utterances.speaker: JOHN SOLOMON, VICE PRESIDENT, THE HILL
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: The one guy that knows we could have found out and he would have either offered proof positive if there was no deal and we would have been able to either confirmed Russia or deny Russia. We know Hillary's e-mail server was hacked by at least six foreign intelligent service, so God knows where it came from. But he could have provided evidence and maybe saved the country from all of this crap and Comey stopped it. Why?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's a great question. No one in the Justice Department really know why Comey was doing it. Some people didn't even know Comey had done it at the time. But here they are in the middle of negotiations. You got senior justice officials having very constructive conversations with Julian Assange his lawyer and all of a sudden Jim Comey is having a side bar with Senator Mark Warner and he passes his message along to Senator Warner saying cut off the investigation, tell that lawyer to stand down. We don't want Assange here. We don't know the reasons why. And the consequences go even beyond Russia. At that moment Assange had a lot of sensitive documents about the CIA, there was a lot of great negotiating going on and they all fell apart--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: This isn't about whether Assange, this is not about WikiLeaks and Assange, but here is a point that I think we've got to be honest about. I'll throw to Sarah.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: Great.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So people like Julian Assange and Kim Dotcom, these are guys that broke in -- he, Assange hacked the DOD and NASA when he was 16. He's now 45. We have 250,000 full time I.T. people working for the government or thereabouts. My question is, you know, fool me once, twice, three, four, 10 times. Shame on you. Fool me 35 years later, shame on me. Why have we not protected everything?

utterances.speaker: SARA CARTER, FOX NEWS CONTRIBUTOR
utterances.utterance: Because it's almost impossible to do so, Sean. The government relies on its ability to protect its documents solely on the employees that have access to these documents. And if they don't -- obviously there's problems within the system. They know the system has faults. And sometimes people within the system, we saw it with Edward Snowden, we've seen it with others like Chelsea Manning. They are able to access these very highly classified documents and somehow get them out of those very classified documents. I think with Julian Assange you brought--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Would the country been better off having found out for sure who did it?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. You agree, Gregg?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: And if Julian was -- absolutely.

utterances.speaker: GREGG JARRETT, LEGAL ANALYST, FOX NEWS
utterances.utterance: Absolutely. I do. And the inevitable conclusion that one can reach here is that Comey knew it wasn't Russia.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So you think Assange lied--

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: It would have exposed the Russia hoax and it would ruin the narrative of Democrats.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: By the way, I believe that, too. That's the problem.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Right. It was that sweetheart deal of the government.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Make the deal.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: And Comey steps in and he puts a stop to this deal that would have protected in intelligence sources and method in addition--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That wa part of it, by the way. They would have protected other people.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Yes. Why in the world would Comey stop it unless it hurt him and his dilating probe of Trump?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me go to another topic. We'll put it on the screen for all of you. The president tweeting it out. So there's a hearing Wednesday with Strzok. And he writes, "The hearing with Strzok and other frauds at the FBI and DOJ should be shown to the public on live TV, not a closed door hearing that nobody will see. We should expose these people for what they are. There should be total transparency." I agree with the president. So Strzok is going to get to hide behind closed doors. John Solomon, instead of facing the American people and letting us decide.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think that's one of the frustrations that the American people have. A lot of this investigation is been behind closed doors and it's only been because of some courageous people coming out and talking that we know half of what we know today. At some point there has to be a final accounting of what went on here. And I think it starts with what the FBI did right and wrong. There's another development going on tonight. We still don't have those documents.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me ask one follow up on Assange while it's in my head.

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Are you convinced, John Solomon, because you're breaking the story--

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- that Assange has -- he would have -- he was a guy that will have proof positive. Are you of the belief that he told the truth that it wasn't Russia?

utterances.speaker: SOLOMON
utterances.utterance: I'd love to see the evidence he was going to provide. He was going to provide technical evidence that would answer who did not provide these documents. That would be critical to any investigation and why it was turned away is a great mystery to me. I mean, we should want transparency in the story.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Sara, back to Peter Strzok. Should it be transparent?

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: It should absolutely be transparent. And this is the reason why Peter Strzok's attorney didn't want him to be subpoenaed why he acted like he wanted to volunteer and he allow to speak to Congress. He knew it would be behind closed doors. And he know that because it's not under subpoena because it's going to talk to members of Congress, he may not have to answer any or all of the questions.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Let me go last question. I'm bouncing back and forth, but this is in my head. So you're saying that American sources and methods as part of the deal with Assange would be protected?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Would have been protected and redacted.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: And maybe would save lives?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Yes, absolutely.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It could have the potential. So why do we do the deal now?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: And we have malware that we utilize on other systems that would have been protected as part of the deal. It's incomprehensible with this deal--

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: So you think this was the best deal we could ever got and would help saved lives--

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Sure.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- and would have told us proof positive on Russia?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: Yes, I think so.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: My gosh. Why don't we make the deal now?

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: It's too late because Julian Assange, according to John Solomon released some of the documents.

utterances.speaker: CARTER
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Well, maybe make me the best deal you can make so the American people can know whether this was a crock from the something.

utterances.speaker: JARRETT
utterances.utterance: It will eventually come out. You cannot hide something this corrupt this long.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. When we come back -- thank you all. Michelle Malkin straight ahead. You went get this news from CBS or fake news CNN.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: So we're building the wall, we're fixing the wall, we're spending a lot of money and we're going for more. And we'll get it done. But Democrats, they want open borders and they don't mind crime. Think of it.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.utterance: So last week they thought they have a great issue. And you know, I get credit -- I don't know if it's true or not but they are saying I have good political instinct. Who knows? In fact, some people have said I have the greatest political instinct in 50 years. I don't think so. I don't think so. But I have my own feeling. When I heard them talking about the children -- first of all, they were using pictures taken in 2014 when Barack Obama was president. I wasn't president.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: That was the president earlier tonight at in a rally in South Carolina. Here with reaction, she is the host of the award-winning Michelle Malkin investigates on CRTV, syndicated columnist and frankly adopted sister, my friend, Michelle Malkin. It's true. We know that. This is the Democrats what they are running on poor text. Open borders, keep Obamacare and they want their crumbs back, meaning the tax cuts, and impeaching the president but don't tell the American people we're going to do it.

utterances.speaker: MICHELLE MALKIN, HOST, CRTV
utterances.utterance: That's right, Sean, my big brother. It's great to see you again. And I have to admire President Trump for getting up every single day when so many other mainstream beltway Republicans would have thrown in the towel and capitulated. He gets up every day cheerfully because he loves this country. However many disagreements I might have with him on minor things, he is fundamentally committed to making sure that we, our country that protects our sovereignty and protects our borders. And he is willing to absorb those slings and arrows of being called a racist and a xenophobe and a nativist and somebody who doesn't care and who is heartless. But it's the Democrats who are the party of anarchy and who are the party of lawlessness. And there is nothing compassionate about allowing the borders to deteriorate.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: What do you make of these threats--

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: -- Pam Bondi, Secretary Nielsen, Sarah Huckabee, Baron Trump, 4- year-old granddaughter, Ivanka, Melania and dreaming of blowing up the White House, et cetera.

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: Yes. Yes. You know, the montages that you show every night are so valuable. You're not going to see it on fake news like you said. You're not going to see it on fake news stations like CBS or CNN. And this is the truth that people need to se and it's why they back this president. There's a climate of hate that is on the rise. It's not new. You and I have been talking about it for years, Sean.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: But his success--

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: I wrote a book in 2006 called "Unhinged," right?

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Everyday he is successful they feel the power in their ads are winning in 2018 slipping away. And to me they're almost they are cheering. They need President Trump to fail for them to get power back. And they've openly advocating about Bill Maher.

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: That's exactly right. Yes. And that is the exact correct diagnosis. Why are we seeing this explosion and this resurgence of all of this insanity and incivility? It's because they are losing on the political and policy arena. The thing that's especially dangerous, is that it's not just prominent Republican officials and cabinet members and it's horrible what happens to the people who have dedicated their lives to serving this president, it's happening to people who are behind the scenes every day its rank and file. And I am especially troubled and alarmed and I want to see more members of Congress talking about this, Sean, about the demonization of immigration and customs agents.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here is my question.

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: This is not the -- right. This is not the fringe. These are mainstream Democrats who are turning our rank and file officers on the border.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Here's my question.

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: It's so -- now they're attacking women and children in almost on a daily basis to any hope of re-election they feel slipping away. Here's my question. Do you -- I'm to the getting to the point I'm worried somebody of these really going to get hurt or get killed here. Am I overreacting to what I'm seeing?

utterances.speaker: MALKIN
utterances.utterance: Well, you know -- no. Of course you're not. These are blatant and brazen incitements to violence. And it already has happened. You had the wonderful and brave and so inspiring Steve Scalise on your show. There's been a number of people who have been targeted. You had, you know, conservative political organizations whose offices have been targeted. Death threats. It's something that I've had to deal with. Anybody in public life. And you know what? It is going to backfire. It is going to backfire. Maxine Waters, keep slapping your mouth open.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: I hope nobody gets hurt. I got to -- all right. Michelle Malkin, always good to see you. Thank you for being with us. When we come back, fake news Jim Acosta called out in a crowd. This is the best tape we've ever shown, next.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: All right. Before President Trump's rally tonight in South Carolina, fake news CNN's Jim Acosta, he was called out by the crowd right in the middle of his on air report. You can't make this up. This is priceless. Take a look.

utterances.speaker: JIM ACOSTA, CNN SENIOR WHITE HOUSE CORRESPONDENT
utterances.utterance: President Trump will be campaigning here in South Carolina later on this evening. It is no secret he is going to hammer the issue of immigration right up until the midterm elections coming up this fall. And even with families being separated with their children at the border, the president believes this issue is a winner for the Republican Party. As you could hear behind me, Wolf, the crowd is very fired up, we have about couple thousand people in this room. So far they are letting the press corps here know exactly how they feel about what we're doing here, Wolf.

utterances.speaker: HANNITY
utterances.utterance: Ouch. Ouch. That hurts. Best newscast they ever did, actually. All right. That's all the time we have left on this show. We will always be fair and balanced. We're not part of the destroy-Trump media. Please set your DVR and tell your friends never miss an episode, we are not them, and we never will be. Let not your heart be troubled. Yes, it is time. She's standing by in our nation's capital. Laura Ingraham, take it away. Content and Programming Copyright 2018 Fox News Network, LLC. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. Copyright 2018 CQ-Roll Call, Inc.
